intro: Pilosella balansae, commonly known as the Balansae goatsbeard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are hairy and often lobed, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc, typical of the family. Pilosella balansae is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
